intro: Sabulina asiyeae, commonly known as the Asian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
